info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 27 at 6:02PM EDT until July 27 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN LACKAWANNA...SOUTHWESTERN WAYNE...CENTRAL LUZERNE AND SOUTHWESTERN PIKE COUNTIES... At 602 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Beach Haven to near Arrowhead Lake to near Pecks Pond, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Wilkes-Barre, Kingston, Berwick, Nanticoke, Plymouth, Edwardsville, Larksville, Ashley, Bear Creek and Dorrance. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
